titleStmt.title: The XII. wonders of the vvorld Set and composed for the violl de gambo, the lute, and the voyce to sing the verse, all three ioyntly, and none seuerall: also lessons for the lute and base violl to play alone: with some lessons to play lyra-wayes alone, or if you will, to fill vp the parts, with another violl set lute-way. Newly composed by Iohn Maynard, lutenist at the most famouse schoole of St. Iulians in Hartfordshire.
titleStmt.author: Maynard, John, b. 1576 or 7.

titleStmt.title: The XII. wonders of the vvorld Set and composed for the violl de gambo, the lute, and the voyce to sing the verse, all three ioyntly, and none seuerall: also lessons for the lute and base violl to play alone: with some lessons to play lyra-wayes alone, or if you will, to fill vp the parts, with another violl set lute-way. Newly composed by Iohn Maynard, lutenist at the most famouse schoole of St. Iulians in Hartfordshire.
titleStmt.author: Maynard, John, b. 1576 or 7.
Davies, John, Sir, 1569-1626. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Snodham for Iohn Browne, and are to be solde at his shop in Saint Dunstones Church-yard in Fleetstreete,

notesStmt.note: For voice with lute accompaniment in tablature; viola da gamba part printed parallel with spine. Lute lessons, and lessons for the lyra violl in tablature with viola da gamba part inverted or printed parallel with the spine. Words by Sir John Davies--NUC Pre-1956 Catalogue.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

list.item: Viola da gamba and lute music
